intro: Tepuianthus sarisarinamensis subsp. sarisarinamensis, commonly known as the Sarisarinamensis Tepuianthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the tepuis of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, elongated leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in the nutrient-poor soils of the high-altitude plateaus, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions. Its floral structure is specialized for pollination by specific insect species, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to its restricted habitat and conservation status, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research.
